{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3566096,"name":"Langston Schatz-Mitchell","username":"Ljman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/dc4da7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T17:12:42.275Z","cooked":"

Ever since our first regional during week 3, we haven’t been able to communicate to our robot. We’re able to connect to the VH-109 radio and RIO separately, but when they are connected to each other they refuse to communicate. We’ve tried switching out the RIO v2 with a RIO v1, changing ethernet cables, connecting to RIO using USB and also ethernet, changing the RIO and VH-109 to a static IP, and countless re-flashing of RIOs and VH-109 radios, making sure to set team number after imaging. We’ve only been able to succeed with using the old Open-Mesh radios, which cannot be used at competitions. Is it possible that both the VH-109 and RIO is broken? is there any other methods that we can try to troubleshoot?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T17:12:42.275Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":220,"reads":224,"readers_count":223,"score":1159.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496607,"topic_slug":"frc-roborio-v2-issues-with-new-vh-radio","display_username":"Langston Schatz-Mitchell","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71169,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/frc-roborio-v2-issues-with-new-vh-radio/496607/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3566101,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T17:18:07.354Z","cooked":"

Let’s start by making sure your full configuration is ok.

When usb hooked into the roborio, go to its webpage at 172.22.11.2 in a browser, and post a picture, specifically of the hostname.

Then connect to the radio, and post a picture of its configuration page (make sure it’s booted for about a minute before doing so)

Why is the link speed 10MB half duplex. That doesn’t look right, it should auto negotiate to 100 which is it’s max. Are u connected directly from Rio to radio?

The rio is connected to the radio over ethernet but they aren’t communicating with each other. (For example, connecting to the radio, we can ping 10.37.92.1 successfully but not 10.37.92.2) That screenshot was when we were connected to the rio over usb.

Is there a way to change this?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T18:35:14.702Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":27.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496607,"topic_slug":"frc-roborio-v2-issues-with-new-vh-radio","display_username":"Keaton Hall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":28614,"username":"legoguy1000","name":"Alex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legoguy1000/{size}/256261_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/frc-roborio-v2-issues-with-new-vh-radio/496607/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566134,"name":"Fletcher","username":"FletcherS7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T18:42:51.768Z","cooked":"
mersenneprime:

Capture2660×887 30.3 KB

The Ethernet link should not be at Half Duplex, This suggests and issue with Ethernet cable between the VH-109 and roboRIO (or any PoE injectors you are using) or an issue with the roboRIO Ethernet port.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T18:42:51.768Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":132,"readers_count":131,"score":56.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":496607,"topic_slug":"frc-roborio-v2-issues-with-new-vh-radio","display_username":"Fletcher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25039,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between."},"post_url":"/t/frc-roborio-v2-issues-with-new-vh-radio/496607/6","custom_user_title":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566147,"name":"Keaton Hall","username":"mersenneprime","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/d26b3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T19:12:06.217Z","cooked":"

Everything seems to work fine (we can run the robot) when we switch to the old Open Mesh radios, so I don’t think it is the Rio port. We’ve been trying many different ethernet cables but the behavior is the same. We’ve also tried both PoE and separate power to the radio, though we can keep trying more configurations.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T19:12:06.217Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":29.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496607,"topic_slug":"frc-roborio-v2-issues-with-new-vh-radio","display_username":"Keaton Hall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":25039,"username":"FletcherS7","name":"Fletcher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/frc-roborio-v2-issues-with-new-vh-radio/496607/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566149,"name":"Fletcher","username":"FletcherS7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T19:15:20.882Z","cooked":"

If you connect another device (such as a laptop) to the VH-109.
Are you able to ping that?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T19:15:20.882Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":29.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496607,"topic_slug":"frc-roborio-v2-issues-with-new-vh-radio","display_username":"Fletcher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69045,"username":"mersenneprime","name":"Keaton Hall","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/d26b3c/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25039,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between."},"post_url":"/t/frc-roborio-v2-issues-with-new-vh-radio/496607/8","custom_user_title":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566179,"name":"Keaton Hall","username":"mersenneprime","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/d26b3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T20:01:34.756Z","cooked":"

Yes, we are able to ping the VH-109 after connecting. The driver station indicates in an error message that it has connection to the radio but not the roboRIO. He is a summary of what setups have worked or not:

Rio connected to laptop via usb or ethernet - Can see roboRIO, set team number, upload/run code, etc.

VH-109 Radio connected (via the DS port) to laptop - Can configure, set team number, update firmware, etc.

VH-109 Radio connected to roboRIO and powered separately - Can connect to radio, but can’t communicate at all with rio.

VH-109 Radio connected to roboRIO with PoE only - Same as above

Open Mesh radio connected to roboRIO with PoE - Can upload and run code as normal.

Those screenshots were taken when we connected to the roboRIO through USB, not ethernet. Could that explain the half duplex speed? We only started running into this issue after we came back from our regional and tried to reconfigure the radio, though we’ve since also switched roboRIOs since the original (which we ran at competition) has a non-operable ethernet port now.

So far, we’ve been using a roboRIO 2.0, but we can try some 1.0’s tomorrow to see if it is an ethernet issue on the roboRIO itself.
